summary: P1 & P2 testing complete. Admin UI for Module Status and UI Style configuration fully functional. All 9 backend tests passed. Frontend verified: Admin login at /admin/login works with email/password, public /login shows only LaoPan OAuth (no email/password fields), Module Status tab shows all 13 modules with status dropdowns/custom labels/preview badges, UI Style tab shows 5 templates with customization options. Home page correctly displays module status badges (Live Beta, Coming Soon). /unatienda route loads correctly.
passed_tests: Backend: GET /api/public/module-status returns default statuses (no auth)
Backend: GET /api/public/ui-style returns default style (no auth)
Backend: POST /api/auth-v2/login with admin credentials returns token
Backend: GET /api/admin/module-status returns statuses with module_names and available_statuses
Backend: PUT /api/admin/module-status saves and returns success, changes reflect on public endpoint
Backend: GET /api/admin/ui-style returns style with 5 available_templates
Backend: PUT /api/admin/ui-style saves and returns success, changes reflect on public endpoint
Frontend: Admin login page at /admin/login loads with email/password form
Frontend: Admin login with admin@libreria.com/admin redirects to /admin
Frontend: Public login at /login shows only LaoPan buttons (no email/password)
Frontend: Administration > Module Status tab loads with all 13 modules
Frontend: Module Status shows status dropdown, custom label input, preview badge
Frontend: Administration > UI Style tab loads with 5 template options
Frontend: UI Style shows customization (Primary Color, Font Family, Border Radius, Card Style)
Frontend: UI Style shows live preview of selected options
Frontend: Home page displays module status badges (Live Beta, Coming Soon)
critical_code_review_comments: Module Status and UI Style endpoints follow existing app_config pattern correctly
Public endpoints are properly unauthenticated, admin endpoints require Bearer token
Frontend uses REACT_APP_BACKEND_URL env variable correctly
ModuleStatusBadge component handles all 4 status types (production shows no badge)
DEFAULT_MODULE_STATUS fallback in config/moduleStatus.js works correctly
Admin tabs have proper data-testid attributes for testing

mocked_apis.note: All APIs are real. No mocked endpoints.

context_for_next_testing_agent: P1/P2 Module Status & UI Style features fully tested. Backend endpoints: GET/PUT /api/admin/module-status, GET/PUT /api/admin/ui-style (admin auth required), GET /api/public/module-status, GET /api/public/ui-style (no auth). Frontend tabs at /admin#admin - Module Status tab allows changing status/custom labels for 13 modules, UI Style tab allows selecting from 5 templates (default/elegant/warm/ocean/minimal) with customization. Home page fetches statuses from /api/public/module-status and displays badges on quick access buttons.
